intro: Spiesia cyanea, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, delicate blue flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Spiesia cyanea typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically valuable plant in native landscapes.
